title: Mars exploration and the debate about planetary protection
summary: Could planetary protection considerations hinder our plans to send humans to Mars?

title: Virgin Orbit scrambles to avoid bankruptcy as deal talks continue
summary: Virgin Orbit is scrambling to secure a funding lifeline and avoid bankruptcy, which could come as early as this week without a deal, CNBC has learned.

title: As launch approaches, JUICE project manager discusses trajectories and science
summary: The European Space Agency’s (ESA) Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (JUICE) spacecraft recently arrived in French Guiana for its upcoming launch, which is currently set for April 13, 2023. JUICE is currently undergoing launch preparations in the Payload Preparation Facility at the Centre Spatial Guyanais (CSG) in Kourou, French Guiana, and will soon be mounted atop the upper stage of the Ariane 5 rocket it will ride into orbit.

title: Arkisys and partners   to show how they would build a satellite in orbit
summary: The U.S. Space Force awarded a $1.6 million contract to a team led by Arkisys to demonstrate robotic satellite assembly.

title: The SpaceX steamroller has shifted into a higher gear this year
summary: We're not at airline-like operations yet, but we're getting a lot closer.

title: ATL Partners forms new holding company focused on space and air sensors
summary: ATL Partners, a private equity firm, announced March 20 it has formed a new holding company called LightRidge Solutions to oversee a portfolio of space and airborne sensors businesses

title: Space industry deals with launch shortage
summary: Even as the space industry complains of a shortage of launch capacity, SpaceX said it has room to increase an already surging pace of launches.

title: NASA's SWOT Spacecraft Resumes Operations After Primary Instrument Shutdown
summary: NASA's Surface Water and Ocean Topography (SWOT) satellite has resumed its commissioning activities after the main scientific instrument, the Ka-band Radar Interferometer (KaRIn), was shut off in late January. According to a press release from the space agency, the KaRIn has been restored to regular operations using a backup power unit.

title: Mars Sample Return cost growth threatens other science missions
summary: NASA’s effort to return samples from Mars is facing increasing costs that is putting pressure not just on other planetary science missions but also a major heliophysics mission.

title: Satellogic sells Earth-imagery satellites
summary: Satellogic, the South American company known for high-resolution multispectral imagery, is selling Earth-observation satellites for around $10 million or less.
